quote.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written
quote.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
She quoted from a newspaper article.
Can I quote you on that?
quote.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to give a piece of information that is written down somewhere
quote.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: You can order by phoning our hotline and quoting your credit card number.
He quoted a figure of 220 deaths each year from accidents in the home.
quote.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to give something as an example to support what you are saying
quote.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Mr Jackson quoted the case of an elderly man who had been evicted from his home.
He quoted the example of France as a country with a good rail service.
The nurses’ union was quoted as an example of a responsible trade union.
quote.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to tell a customer the price you will charge them for a service or product
quote.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The firm originally quoted £6,000 for the whole job.
quote.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to give the price of a share or currency
quote.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: The pound was quoted this morning at just under $1.46.
The company is now quoted on the stock exchange (=people can buy and sell shares in it).
quote.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing
quote.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a quote from the minister’s speech
quote.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a statement of how much it will probably cost to build or repair something
quote.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Always get a quote before proceeding with repair work.
quote.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to tell a customer the price you will charge them for a service or product
quote.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Hotels often quote a special rate for groups who use the hotel on a regular basis.
quote.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to give the price of a share or currency
quote.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The company’s shares were quoted at $35.375, down 12.5 cents.
The dollar was quoted at 124.85 yen.
quote.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a written statement of how much something will cost, for example some building work
quote.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Always get a quote before proceeding with work.
